title: AtoZ CSS News
subject_line: AtoZ CSS News: BEM, zooming experiments, multi-lingual design and more!
tag_line: My favourite articles and news plus a new CSS tip
intro_text: I can't believe it's September already! But what better way to kick off a new month than by reading some great CSS articles? :)

news.link_text: BEMIT: Taking the naming convention further
news.link_comment: I'm always interested to read Harry Roberts' thoughts on CSS and this article is definitely thought provoking. If you're a fan of the BEM naming convention, you may like this collection of ideas for adding even more meaning to your code.

In this article, Joni writes up an experiment that he's implemented on his site for a zooming transition between pages. It's a really interesting proof of concept and his whole site is full of great content too.

news.link_text: 13 Tips for Making Responsive Design Multi-Lingual
news.link_comment: I've recently completed a multi-lingual site for an international tequila brand and I wish I'd read this post from the BBC before hand. There's loads of great tips including some surprising revelations about the difference between nations and languages.

So much of what we design and develop centers around text that I wouldn't be surprised if someone has coined the phrase “typography first”. This site provides a resource roundup of books, websites, videos and tools for improving your typographic skills.

news.link_text: The future of layout with CSS: Grid Layouts
news.link_comment: If you've read my Guide to Layout and Document Flow book, you'll already know about the new Grid Layout spec but in this article, Patrick gives a great overview of what it is, how it works and why it's the future of CSS layouts.
